advice_to_mgmt: There is an opportunity to better encourage cooperation and collaboration between departments. Also an opportunity to better define the role and scope of departments as work ultimately falls to the individuals capable of doing it rather than holding individuals accountable to role responsibilities.

pros: You get paid every Thursday or Friday. Overtime is usually not mandatory, but workers still stay for the extra hour. Medical, dental, and 401k benefits. The pay wage is $12/hr I believe.
cons:
• Must wear very warm clothes. Temperatures will reach 35-45 ℃

• Requesting days off aren't approved often. Because there is not enough employees for a back up. (You)

• Break room is over crowded. Especially clocking in.

• Only get 10 minute breaks, I honestly think 15 minutes is best.

• Parking is insufficient.

•Schedule changes every month.
advice_to_mgmt: As long as you have good attitude. I wouldn't see any problems.

pros: A place to cut your teeth in learning about HACCP's and other critical steps for a food manufacturing facility
cons: The language barrier is something that needs to be fixed and if that's not going to happen then upper management needs to make it to the floor more often and not just before going home at 230pm
advice_to_mgmt: Visit the floor more often, don't just assume everything is alright. Wheeled the power your give not only with authority but with grace. Stop leaving your people out on a limb. If something happens, all though they are to blame you are ultimately blame.

review_title: A decent place to work if you need work
years_at_company: A decent place to work if you need work

advice_to_mgmt: Pay your employees more if you want them to stay

pros: Absolutely loved interning with this company! Taylor Farms has a lot to offer you if you are a hard worker and do well with minor supervision. If you are a creative individual with problem solving abilities and are willing to grow/excited to learn, this is a wonderful interning environment. The company is extremely open to interns asking questions and offering new ideas. They are a large company but offer a somewhat small company dynamic as an intern is allowed to explore virtually all aspects of the produce business. I highly recommend an internship with this company in any department of you have the opportunity.
cons: I don't have any to mention. This company offered me immense opportunities to grow professionally. I had both challenging days and some days that slower thay allowed me to catch up on big projects. They are fantastic.
advice_to_mgmt: None to mention. I felt incredibly respected by my employer(s) / immediate boss. I felt welcomed to share my ideas and appreciated in my efforts.

pros: Great, hard-working hourly employee population
cons: Hours, lack of senior leadership, deceptive leadership, disregard for employment/labor laws and employee safety
advice_to_mgmt: Admit you have no clue about managing this business or inspiring employees. Get out of your offices and actually talk to employees

review_title: A business unit in transition with some growth opportunities.
years_at_company: A business unit in transition with some growth opportunities.
pros: Comparable benefits, high quality product line, work/life balance is moderate, high profile customers
cons: Regional plant still in transition, corporate organizational restructuring causing distress amongst employees with tenure.
advice_to_mgmt: More transparent and proactive communication around transitional plans with regard to personnel changes.

review_title: Plan on working many hours even every holiday!
years_at_company: Plan on working many hours even every holiday!
pros: There are not many advantages working for this company. The 401k program is good but no one stays long enough to take advantage of it. No one stays at this company as a career.
cons: Where do I start? Plan on working at least 70 hours per week and plan on working every holiday! They never close. Leadership here is a joke too. They play mind games and are very unprofessional. Morale is horrible which I can understand after being here for close to a year I can understand why. Very sad situation. Turnover at the HR, Payroll and Supervisor positions is extreme. They have many issues here at this location in Swedesboro.
advice_to_mgmt: Take a week and speak to the employees on the floor. Ask them for their opinions on why everyone is leaving.
